sections.html: The map shows a network of terms that co-occur in the same paragraphs of the ENB, Volume 12. Node position is determined by a force vector algorithm in Gephi (Jacomy et al., forthcoming) bringing together terms directly or indirectly linked, and keeping away terms with fewer co-occurrences. Node size is proportional to their frequency in the corpus. Node color follows the clusters identified by the clustering algorithm. The names of the clusters have been attributed manually. Adaptation themes, whilst fewer than those of mitigation, are central.
sections.title: How to read the map

sections.html:
Our corpus was built from user comments on the Facebook pages of 23 French newspapers (9 national and 14 regional). All comments from September 2013 and February 2014 were included which were returned on the basis of the query “climat/ rechauffement” (climate/ warming).

February 2014 was selected for inclusion as a month of intense storms in France, and contrasted with September 2013 which was a relatively quiet month in terms of weather events.

The second step is dedicated to analysis. Netvizz and its comments analytics tool was used.
